rename.from: YAMLMapper incorrectly handles numbers with underscores in them
rename.to: `YAMLParser` incorrectly handles numbers with underscores in them

issue.title: (yaml) Does not handle octal or hexadecimal representations of integers

labels.name: yaml
labels.description: Issue related to YAML format backend

repository.name: jackson-dataformats-text
repository.description: Uber-project for (some) standard Jackson textual format backends: csv, properties, yaml (xml to be added in future)

issue.body:
(from: https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-dataformat-yaml/issues/37 by @jvantuyl)

The use of BigInteger for really big integers introduces an interesting behavior.  For a very large zero-prefixed number, it won't see a leading zero as indicating octal (because BigInteger's constructor doesn't mirror Integer.parseInt or Long.parseLong).

In the long run, also doesn't support the 0o644 notation from YAML 1.2, which I'm starting to see floating about.

body:
Fixed for `2.9.4` / `master`.

NOTE: #3 should also be fixed (non-decimal base numbers like binary, hex), in related area.
But wanted to get this out of the way first
Wow! Thanks for the quick fix!
@mkobit No problems, my pleasure: thank you for reporting it! (surprised no one else had done that earlier but better late than never)
